labels_to_headlines.C0: City reports decrease in traffic deaths to 17 in first year of Vision Zero safety program.
labels_to_headlines.G0: Officials report fewer traffic deaths and new safety efforts in the first year of the Vision Zero program.
labels_to_headlines.O0: City Council reviews Vision Zero annual memo highlighting progress on traffic safety and new enforcement programs
labels_to_headlines.M0: Mayor's Vision Zero Plan Appears on Track, Still Awaiting Traffic Fatality Data
labels_to_headlines.C1: Council calls on Governor to provide state resources to help clean up Pittsburgh's trash and litter problem.
labels_to_headlines.G1: City Council will ask the governor for state help with litter after removing a "state of emergency" request.
labels_to_headlines.O1: City Council urges Governor to support cleanup efforts by supplementing resources to address Pittsburgh’s litter problem
labels_to_headlines.M1: Council Seeks State Assistance in Eliminating the City’s Litter and Illegal Dumpsites
labels_to_headlines.C2: Council refers resolution to accept $37,000 grant for investigating old sexual assault cases to committee.
labels_to_headlines.G2: Council introduces legislation to accept a $37,000 grant for investigating old sexual assault cases.
labels_to_headlines.O2: Council authorizes agreement to receive $37,000 grant for sexual assault case investigations and police training
labels_to_headlines.M2: Untested Sexual Assault Kits to Be Processed
labels_to_headlines.C3: Council refers resolution allowing Duquesne Light and Pittsburgh Water to install utility poles and wires on city property at no cost to committee.
labels_to_headlines.G3: Council to consider granting Duquesne Light and Pittsburgh Water access to city land for utility upgrades.
labels_to_headlines.O3: Council approves easement agreements with Duquesne Light and Pittsburgh Water for pole installation and landscaping at no cost to the City
labels_to_headlines.C4: Council approves sewage plan revision for new apartment development at 296 McKee Place at no cost to the city.
labels_to_headlines.G4: Council reviews a sewage plan update for a new apartment building on McKee Place.
labels_to_headlines.O4: Council adopts sewage plan revision for 296 McKee Place at no cost to the city
labels_to_headlines.C5: Council refers resolution to approve sewage plan for South Side townhome development to committee.
labels_to_headlines.G5: Council refers sewage plan for new South Side townhome development to committee.
labels_to_headlines.O5: Council adopts sewage plan revision for 215 South 21st Street at no cost to city
labels_to_headlines.C6: City Council considers allowing ALCOSAN to build underground tunnels through nine city properties for $8,200.
labels_to_headlines.G6: City to be paid $8,200 for allowing ALCOSAN to build sewer tunnels under nine city properties.
labels_to_headlines.O6: City approves easements for underground tunnels on nine city properties with $8,200 payment
labels_to_headlines.C7: City Council refers resolution to transfer 14 properties in 12th Ward to Larimer Consensus Group to settle court cases.
labels_to_headlines.G7: City Council introduces legislation to transfer 14 properties to the Larimer Consensus Group to settle multiple lawsuits.
labels_to_headlines.O7: City Council approves sale of 12th Ward properties to Larimer Consensus Group to settle court cases
labels_to_headlines.C8: Council authorizes city officials to apply for $250,000 state grant to help fund Emerald View Trail repairs.
labels_to_headlines.G8: Council introduces a resolution to apply for a $250,000 state grant for the Emerald View Trail rehabilitation project.
labels_to_headlines.O8: Council authorizes application for $250,000 grant to rehabilitate Emerald View Trail with city match funding
labels_to_headlines.C9: Council refers resolution for University of Pittsburgh to provide free supplemental waste services in Oakland neighborhood.
labels_to_headlines.G9: University of Pittsburgh would provide supplemental trash pickup in Oakland under a proposed agreement.
labels_to_headlines.O9: Council approves agreement with University of Pittsburgh for free supplemental waste services in Oakland neighborhood
labels_to_headlines.C10: City Council approves $316,367 settlement for Finland Street Pedestrian Bridge lawsuit.
labels_to_headlines.G10: City accepts $316,367 to settle lawsuit involving the Finland Street Pedestrian Bridge.
labels_to_headlines.O10: City Council approves $316,367 settlement for Finland Street Pedestrian Bridge litigation
labels_to_headlines.C11: Council approves three-year agreement with USI Insurance Services for city insurance brokerage services.
labels_to_headlines.G11: City Council authorizes a no-cost agreement with USI Insurance Services for insurance brokerage services.
labels_to_headlines.O11: Council approves no-cost, three-year insurance brokerage agreement with USI Insurance Services
labels_to_headlines.C12: Council approves $1.1 million increase for Liberty Avenue project using additional federal highway funding.
labels_to_headlines.G12: City Council approves over $1 million in new federal funding for improvements on Liberty Avenue.
labels_to_headlines.O12: Council approves $1.06 million increase in Liberty Avenue project budget with federal funding
labels_to_headlines.C13: Council approves $32,750 contract for video production company to create police recruitment videos.
labels_to_headlines.G13: City Council approves $32,750 contract for police recruitment videos.
labels_to_headlines.O13: City Council approves $32,750 contract with Kicker Inc. for police recruitment videos
labels_to_headlines.M13: Council to Approve Funding for Recruitment Video Aimed at Addressing Police Shortages
labels_to_headlines.C14: Council approves amended resolution to accept reduced $250,000 state grant for Smallman Street Complete Street Project.
labels_to_headlines.G14: City Council accepts a $250,000 state grant for the Smallman Street project.
labels_to_headlines.O14: Council approves amended grant agreement for Smallman Street Complete Street Project with reduced funding
labels_to_headlines.C15: Council approves $5.4 million increase for Liberty Avenue highway safety project costs.
labels_to_headlines.G15: City Council approves $5.4 million in additional funding for the Liberty Avenue safety project.
labels_to_headlines.O15: Council approves $5.4 million increase for Liberty Ave Highway Safety Improvement Program
labels_to_headlines.C16: Council approves additional $317,588 for South Negley Avenue Bridge Project, bringing total contract to $1.2 million.
labels_to_headlines.G16: Council approves a contract increase of more than $317,000 for the South Negley Avenue Bridge Project.
labels_to_headlines.O16: Council approves $1.19 million supplemental agreement with WSP USA for South Negley Avenue Bridge Project
labels_to_headlines.C17: Council approves $93,000 increase for Office of Community Health and Safety vehicles and equipment purchase.
labels_to_headlines.G17: Council approves $93,000 for new vehicles and equipment for the Office of Community Health and Safety.
labels_to_headlines.O17: Council approves $93,000 increase for vehicle and equipment purchases for Community Health and Safety office
labels_to_headlines.C18: Council approves $382,513 increase for Haverhill Project bringing total city reimbursement to Pittsburgh Water to $992,629.
labels_to_headlines.G18: Council approves an additional $382,513 for the Haverhill stormwater and road project.
labels_to_headlines.O18: City Council approves increased reimbursement of $992,628.77 to Pittsburgh Water for Haverhill Project costs
labels_to_headlines.C19: Council approves agreement with state transportation department to share road and bridge maintenance services at no cost to the city.
labels_to_headlines.G19: City Council authorizes an agreement with PennDOT to share road and bridge maintenance.
labels_to_headlines.O19: City Council approves agreement with PennDOT for exchange of in-kind services at no cost to city
labels_to_headlines.C20: Council holds resolution to cancel $40,000 property sale on Bodkin Street for one week.
labels_to_headlines.G20: Council delays vote on canceling a property sale for one week.
labels_to_headlines.O20: Council holds resolution to rescind 2022 property sale for one week
labels_to_headlines.C21: Council committee to review $33,292 tuition reimbursement for Mohammed Burny by April 23.
labels_to_headlines.G21: A resolution for a $33,292 tuition reimbursement is held in committee.
labels_to_headlines.O21: Council holds tuition reimbursement payment for Mohammed Burny for further review
labels_to_headlines.C22: Council holds resolution to sell city-owned property on Itin Street for $3,755.
labels_to_headlines.G22: Council delays decision on sale of 23rd Ward property.
labels_to_headlines.O22: City Council holds resolution on sale of 23rd Ward property for two weeks
labels_to_headlines.C23: Council holds resolution to transfer $33,292 from salaries to employee benefits for tuition reimbursement.
labels_to_headlines.G23: Council places a two-week hold on a $33,292 tuition reimbursement for an employee.
labels_to_headlines.O23: Council holds resolution to transfer $33,292 for tuition reimbursement for two weeks
labels_to_headlines.C24: Council delays decision on agreement allowing community college students to train with city emergency medical services.
labels_to_headlines.G24: Proposed EMS student training partnership with the community college is held in committee.
labels_to_headlines.O24: Council holds decision on EMS student training agreement with Community College of Allegheny County
labels_to_headlines.C25: Council approves reduced Penn Avenue lighting grant for East Liberty business district enhancement project.
labels_to_headlines.G25: Pittsburgh to accept $450,000 state grant for enhanced lighting in the East Liberty business district.
labels_to_headlines.O25: Council approves reduced $450,000 grant for Penn Avenue Lighting project in East Liberty
labels_to_headlines.M25: City Receives State Funds for New Lighting Along Penn Ave in East Liberty
labels_to_headlines.C26: Council approves additional $115,170 for Fort Pitt Park design services, bringing total cost to $415,170.
labels_to_headlines.G26: Council recommends an additional $115,170 for design work on Fort Pitt Park improvements.
labels_to_headlines.O26: City Council approves $115,170 increase for Fort Pitt Park Phase 1 design services with Pashek + MTR
labels_to_headlines.C27: Council approves easement agreements allowing Duquesne Light and Pittsburgh Water to install utility poles and maintain landscaping on city property at no cost.
labels_to_headlines.G27: Council committee recommends granting Duquesne Light and Pittsburgh Water use of city land for new utility equipment.
labels_to_headlines.O27: City Council approves easement agreements with Duquesne Light and Pittsburgh Water for utility installations and landscaping at no cost to the City
labels_to_headlines.C28: Council approves $52,962 payment for one-year Pennsylvania Municipal League subscription.
labels_to_headlines.G28: Council approves a nearly $53,000 payment for a one-year subscription to the Pennsylvania Municipal League.
labels_to_headlines.O28: Council approves $52,962 subscription payment to Pennsylvania Municipal League
labels_to_headlines.C29: Council approves $72,500 payment to state utility commission for overdue 811 damage prevention call fees.
labels_to_headlines.G29: Council recommends paying a $72,500 debt for 811 damage prevention calls.
labels_to_headlines.O29: City Council approves $72,500 payment to Pennsylvania Public Utility Commission for 811 damage prevention debts
labels_to_headlines.C30: Council approves repealing 2019 resolution that gave redevelopment authority rights to 15th Ward property.
labels_to_headlines.G30: The Urban Redevelopment Authority will no longer acquire a city-owned property in the 15th Ward.
labels_to_headlines.O30: Council approves repeal of 2019 resolution allowing Urban Redevelopment Authority to acquire city property in 15th Ward
labels_to_headlines.C31: Council approves sale of two Hill District lots from redevelopment authority to Pittsburgh Land Bank for $16,290.
labels_to_headlines.G31: Two Hill District lots recommended for transfer to the Pittsburgh Land Bank.
labels_to_headlines.O31: Council approves land sale contract between URA and Pittsburgh Land Bank for 5th Ward property
labels_to_headlines.C32: Council approves sale of city land on Island Avenue to Island Avenue Holdings for $3,600.
labels_to_headlines.G32: Council recommends selling a URA-owned lot on Island Avenue for $3,600.
labels_to_headlines.O32: Council approves sale of city land on Island Avenue to Island Avenue Holdings LLC
labels_to_headlines.C33: Council approves sale of North Aiken Avenue property from redevelopment authority to Pittsburgh Land Bank for $48,500.
labels_to_headlines.G33: Urban Redevelopment Authority to sell North Aiken Avenue property to the Pittsburgh Land Bank.
labels_to_headlines.O33: Council approves sale of land on North Aiken Avenue to Pittsburgh Land Bank
